title: Frictional forces - applied force vs time graph

content.question: A box rests on a horizontal surface where the coefficients of static and kinetic friction between the box and the surface are <math alttext="mu sub s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>k</mi></msub></math>, respectively, and <math alttext="mu sub k equals the fraction mu sub s, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>k</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>s</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. A linearly increasing horizontal applied force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted on the box starting at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, as shown in the graph. The box begins to accelerate at a time between <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>. The force of friction exerted on the box at times <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="t sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> has the magnitudes <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="f sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following claims about <math alttext="f sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is correct?

choices.label: It is greater than <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
It is less than <math alttext="f sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>.
It is equal to <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
It is equal to <math alttext="f sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>.

content.answer: It is greater than <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
